definition: to order (sb) around/to send on an errand/to order away
surname Zhi
to support/to sustain/to erect/to raise/branch/division/to draw money/classifier for rods such as pens and guns, for army divisions and for songs or compositions
to make/to cause/to enable/to use/to employ/to send/to instruct sb to do sth/envoy/messenger

sentences.english: These things she did without a word and without being commanded to do them.
sentences.chinese: 这些活计，她总是一声不响地去干，没有谁支使她。

sentences.english: It was obvious he was used to ordering people around.
sentences.chinese: 很明显，他习惯了支使人。

sentences.english: To tell the truth, Jack doesn't like to be ordered to do this and that.
sentences.chinese: 说实在的，杰克不愿意让人支使来支使去的。

sentences.english: To tell the truth, Jack doesn't like to be ordered to do this and that.
sentences.chinese: 说实在的，杰克不愿意让人支使来支使去的。

sentences.english: He gets his kicks bossing people around.
Mary bullies her little brother into running errands for her.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽仗势支使她的弟弟替她跑腿。

sentences.english: Both code snippets will retrieve the tasks where the assignee currently is the given user.
sentences.chinese: 上述两个代码片断都能够取出用户被支使的使命列表。

sentences.english: I think you have got no right to order me about.
sentences.chinese: 我想你没有权利支使我干这干那的。

sentences.english: They made him wash the car.
They make him wash the car.
Mr Johnson is now under my feet.
sentences.chinese: 约翰逊先生现在听我支使了。

sentences.english: Mrs. White is used to ordering about her husband.
sentences.chinese: 怀特太太习惯于支使她的丈夫。

definition: to order sb about/to use sb
to serve/to wait upon
to call to come and shout to go (idiom); to yell orders/always bossing people around
to send/to assign/to appoint/servants of an official/official messenger
official post/billet/commission/CL:件[jian4]/see also 差事[chai1 shi5]
to serve/to wait upon
to send sb away (with an excuse)
odd jobs/part-time worker
to attend to/to care for (patients etc)/to look after/to wait upon/to serve/also written 伏侍, see also 服事[fu2 shi4]
to play with/to engage in/to resort to/to dally with
to urge sb on
servant
to send (on errand)
to gesticulate while talking (idiom); to explain by waving one's hands/to criticize or give orders summarily/also written 指手畫腳|指手画脚
unskilled labor/heavy manual work
to obey an order/to take orders/to accept a state of affairs
to shy away from work/to get by without attending duty
